Significant Corporate Development: Newspaper Publication Regarding Transfer of Equity Shares to IEPF Significant Corporate Development: Newspaper Publication Regarding Transfer of Equity Shares to IEPF

On August 27, 2025, Asian Paints Ltd. published a notice in newspapers regarding the transfer of equity shares to the Investor Education and Protection Fund (IEPF) Authority. This action was taken in accordance with Regulation 30, read with Para A, Part A of Schedule III of the Listing Regulations.

This notice served as a communication to shareholders about the impending transfer of their shares to the IEPF Authority, as mandated by the Companies Act, 2013, and the IEPF Authority (Accounting, Audit, Transfer and Refund) Rules, 2016.

Note: While this is a significant corporate development requiring disclosure, it pertains to a regulatory compliance matter and does not necessarily indicate a change in the company's financial performance or business strategy.

On August 27, 2025, Axis Bank clarified that recent technical changes to asset quality recognition norms were the cause of a spike in reported slippages during the first quarter of FY26 . Management stated that the new norms would have a minimal economic impact going forward.

Key details from the announcement:

In a Q1 FY26 earnings call, Axis Bank management explained that a technical, rather than fundamental, reclassification of certain retail accounts led to higher-than-usual reported slippages.

Despite this, the bank stated it is well-positioned for faster-than-industry growth from fiscal year 2026, supported by a strong balance sheet and stabilizing retail stress.

Management also noted that margins are expected to widen over the medium term.

CIPLA Ltd had two notable corporate developments on August 27, 2025: a product recall in the U.S. and the completion of a strategic acquisition .

Cipla is recalling over 20,000 packs of its Ibuterol Sulfate Inhalation Aerosol in the U.S., as confirmed by a U.S. Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) report.

The recall was initiated on July 24 due to "Failed Stability Specifications" related to "Out-of-specification results" found during particle size distribution analysis at the 12-month time point.

Cipla announced it completed its acquisition of a 20% stake in Bengaluru-based iCaltech Innovations Private Limited.

The partnership is intended to build integrated healthcare solutions by combining Cipla's pharmaceutical expertise with iCaltech's medical device technologies, with a focus on respiratory care and diagnostics.

Cipla first announced its plan to invest about ₹5 crore for the stake on July 21, 2025.

As of August 27, 2025, Coal India Ltd. (CIL) announced a change in its senior management . In other developments, a CIL subsidiary signed an agreement for a Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) project.

CIL filed a disclosure under Regulation 30 (LODR) concerning a change in its senior management.

Specific details of the personnel changes were not available on the filing date but were disclosed the next day, August 28.

CIL subsidiary Central Mine Planning and Design Institute (CMPDI) signed a Memorandum of Agreement for a CSR initiative.

The agreement, signed with Manmukh Education Consultancy, aims to train 60 underprivileged youth in Ranchi as phlebotomy technicians.

On August 27, 2025, ETERNAL Ltd (parent company of Zomato and Blinkit) was in the news for receiving three GST tax demand and penalty orders totaling over ₹40 crore .

The tax demand was imposed by the Joint Commissioner-4, Bengaluru, and covers the period from July 2017 to March 2020.

The total amount includes ₹17.19 crore in GST, ₹21.42 crore in interest, and a penalty of ₹1.71 crore.

The demand was issued for alleged underpayment of output tax and excess availment of input tax credit.

According to a regulatory filing made on Monday, August 25, the company intends to challenge the order, stating that it has a strong case based on legal counsel and does not anticipate a financial impact.

The following significant corporate developments for GRASIM Ltd were published on or around August 27, 2025, primarily citing information from the company's 78th Annual General Meeting (AGM) on August 26, 2025:

Expansion of chemical business:The company announced it will commission two new chemical facilities, for Epichlorohydrin (ECH) and Chlorinated Polyvinyl Chloride (CPVC), at its Vilayat plant during fiscal year 2025–26. Grasim stated this expansion will strengthen its position in the advanced materials market.

Market capitalization milestone:Grasim's chairman, Kumar Mangalam Birla, announced that the company's market capitalization had reached an all-time high of approximately ₹1,95,000 crore, putting it within "striking distance" of the ₹2 lakh crore milestone.

Capital expenditure details:The company highlighted its substantial capital expenditure, noting that between FY20 and FY25, it spent ₹67,000 crore. Of this, ₹51,000 crore was allocated to growth initiatives, including its core businesses and new ventures.

B2B e-commerce platform growth:Grasim provided an update on its B2B e-commerce platform, Birla Pivot, stating it has reached a revenue run rate of over ₹5,500 crore. The platform is also a key component of the company's strategy to expand into new, high-growth areas.

Growth in the decorative paints segment:Updates were provided on the new decorative paints venture, Birla Opus. At the AGM, Birla noted the "meteoric rise" of the business and confirmed that a sixth manufacturing facility would be commissioned soon. This will give Birla Opus an estimated 24% of India's total installed capacity in decorative paints.

Record Date:The bank set August 27, 2025, as the record date to determine the shareholders eligible for the bonus issue.

Bonus Ratio:The 1:1 ratio meant eligible shareholders received one new equity share for every share they held.

Significant corporate news for Tata Motors Ltd. on August 27, 2025, involved the approval of its major restructuring plan by the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) . This allows the company to demerge its commercial vehicle business and merge the passenger vehicle business into two separate listed entities.

Demerger approval: The NCLT's sanction of the Composite Scheme of Arrangement, originally ordered on August 25, became a focus of market discussion on August 27. The scheme permits the demerger of the commercial vehicle (CV) business into TML Commercial Vehicles Ltd. and the merger of the passenger vehicle (PV) and electric vehicle (EV) businesses into a separate entity.

Future listing plans: Following the demerger, the two entities are expected to be listed separately in the third quarter of the 2026 financial year.

Demerger ratio: The approved demerger plan confirms a 1:1 share-split ratio, meaning existing shareholders will receive one share of the new company for each share of Tata Motors they own.

On August 27, 2025, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) announced the formation of a new Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Services Transformation unit .

Key details of the announcement include:

Purpose: The new unit is designed to consolidate TCS's existing AI teams and capabilities into a single entity. The strategic move emphasizes the company's commitment to prioritizing AI for future growth by delivering specific solutions and accelerating innovation across different industries.

Leadership: The new unit will be headed globally by Amit Kapur, who previously led the company's UK and Ireland business. His appointment as Chief AI and Services Transformation Officer will be effective September 1, 2025.

Operational structure: Kapur will report directly to Aarthi Subramanian, TCS President and Chief Operating Officer. The unit will work closely with other service units and business groups within the company to scale the application of AI and data capabilities across its service offerings.

The most significant corporate news for Wipro on August 27, 2025, was its acquisition of the Digital Transformation Solutions (DTS) business unit of HARMAN for $375 million .

Purpose of the acquisition:The deal is intended to enhance Wipro's Engineering Research & Development (ER&D) services and expand its offerings in next-generation engineering solutions.

Acquired assets:The DTS business unit, a Samsung company, includes more than 5,600 employees across the Americas, Europe, and Asia.

Expected benefits:The acquisition will combine the expertise of DTS with Wipro's capabilities, helping clients with their digital transformations. It is expected to create a more agile and comprehensive specialist provider of engineering solutions.

Timeliness:An announcement about this acquisition was published on August 27, 2025. It follows earlier media reports from mid-August that Wipro was in competition with a private equity firm for the business.
